SourceText:
Crisis can happen to anyone. 

Let's see what happened with @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 and @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver:
text:
Inkinga ingavelela noma ubani. 

Ake sibone ukuthi yini eyenzeke ku @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 no @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver wakhe:

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Shame my dear, you look really upset, do you want to tell me what happened?"
text: @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: “Bandla sthandwa sami, ubonakala uthukuthele ngempela, ungathanda ukungitshela ukuthi kwenzekeni?”
note: The string @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver should not be translated.

SourceText:
@global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: "It’s true, he… he… made me do it! He made me have sex with him! I didn’t want to, I swear, and I even said NO, but he told me I would be in trouble."

@global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Thank you for sharing this with me. You are not in trouble. This is not your fault."
text:
@global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: “Ngiqinisile, u... u... ungenze ngakwenza! Ungenze ngaya ocansini naye! Bengingafuni, ngiyafunga, ngize ngasho nokuthi CHA, kodwa wathi ngizoba senkingeni.”

@global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: “Ngiyabonga ngokungitshela lokhu. Awukho enkingeni. Lokhu akulona iphutha lakho.”

SourceText:
@global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Ah I know, let’s go to the clinic. They will know what we can do to help you. Does that sound okay to you?"

@global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: "Yes… Okay… But will you come with me?"
text:
@global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: “Ah ngiyazi, ake sihambe siye emtholampilo. Bazokwazi ukuthi yini okumelwe siyenze ukuze sikusize. Ingabe lokhu kuzwakala kukahle kuwe?”

@global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: “Yebo... Kulungile... Kodwa ngicela ukuhamba nawe?”

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Of course I will. And @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1? Remember this is not your fault. I love you. You are a good person. We will get through this."
text: @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: “Nakanjani ngizohamba nawe. Bese @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1? Khumbula ukuthi lokhu akulona iphutha lakho.” Ngiyakuthanda. Uwumuntu okahle. Sizodlula kulokhu.”

SourceText: This was such a difficult situation for @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 and her @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver! This can happen to boys and girls.
text: Lesi bekuyisimo esinzima kakhulu ku@global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 naku @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver! Loku kungenzeka kubafana nakumantombazane.

SourceText: What skills did @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver use?
text: Yiwaphi amakhono u @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver awasebenzisile?
note: The string @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver should not be translated.

SourceText: Yes, @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver actually used all those skills – and so can you!
text: Yebo, empeleni @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver uwasebenzise wonke lawo makhono – nawe ungakwazi ukwenza kanjalo!
note: The string @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver should not be translated.

SourceText: Another problem that many parents are worried about is violence and crime. Let’s look at an example together.
text: Enye inkinga abazali abakhathazeke ngayo udlame nobugebengu. Ake sibheke isibonelo ndawonye.

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1, you look worried since yesterday. What is wrong?"
text: @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1, ubukela ukhathazekile kusukela izolo. Ingabe kukhona okungalungile?”

SourceText:
@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: "Yesterday, my friends and I went to a soccer match. Some guys who were drunk started a fight with my friend."

@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "Continue, I am listening. I hope you did not fight?"
text:
@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: “Izolo, mina nabangane bami sihambe sayobuka umdlalo webhola lezinyawo. Abanye abafana ababedakiwe baqala ukulwa nomngane wami." 

@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: “Qhubeka, ngilalele. Ngithemba ukuthi awuzange ulwe?”

SourceText:
@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: "I didn’t want to, but I couldn’t just stand there and let them beat up my friend, so…"

@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "So, did you fight in order to help defend your friend?"
text:
@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: “Bengingafuni, kodwa bengingeke ngime ngibukele beshaya umngane wami, ngakho-ke...”

@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: “Ngakho, ulwile ukuze uvikele umngane wakho?”

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: “Everyone was fighting. I saw someone lying on the field in a pool of blood. He looked… dead."
text: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: “Wonke umuntu ubelwa. Ngibone othile alele phansi kugcwele igazi yonke indawo. Ubebonakala... efile.”
note: The string @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1 should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "I am glad you are telling me about this, @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1. Let’s sit down together now and discuss whether we should involve the police or someone else to help."
text: @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: “Ngiyajabula ukuthi ungitshele ngalokhu, @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1. Ake sihlale phansi manje sixoxe ngokuthi ingabe kuyadingeka sifake amaphoyisa noma omunye umuntu ukuba asize.”

SourceText:
@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: "Thank you, @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1"

@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "We will get through this. Remember, we will support you as a family."
text:
@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: “Ngiyabonga, @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1"

@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: “Sizodlula kulokhu. Khumbula, sizokusekela njengomndeni.”

SourceText: This was such a difficult situation for @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1 and his @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1!
text: Lesi bekuyisimo esinzima kakhulu ku@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1 naku @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1!

SourceText: What skills did @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1 use?
text: Imaphi amakhono u @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1 awasebenzisile?
note: The string @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1 should not be translated.

SourceText: All these skills can help in a crisis.
text: Onke la makhono angasebenza lapho kunenkinga.

SourceText: Crisis can make us feel angry or helpless. But this is when our teens really need us to breathe, listen and think.
text: Inkinga ingakwenza uzizwe ucasukile noma ungelusizo lwalutho. Kodwa kungaleso sikhathi lapho intsha yethu idinga sidonse umoya, silalele futhi sicabange.

SourceText: BREATHE
text: DONSA UMOYA

SourceText: Stay calm. Ask yourself ‘what does my teen need right now’
text: Hlala uzolile. Zibuze ‘yini edingwa ingane yami eseminyakeni yokuthomba njengamanje’

SourceText: LISTEN
text: LALELA

SourceText: Tell them you are there for them and love them.
text: Batshele ukuba ukhonela bona bese uyabathanda.

SourceText: THINK
text: CABANGA

SourceText: Talk with your teen. What might help the situation? You might need to make immediate plans now, and then long-term plans later.
text: Khuluma ingane yami eseminyakeni yokuthomba. Yini engasiza kulesi simo? Kungase kudingeke wenze izinhlelo ezisheshayo manje, bese wenza izinhlelo zesikhathi esizayo kamuva.

SourceText: You can be proud of yourself for exploring ways to get help!
text: Uzoziqhenya ngawe ngokwakho ngokuhlola izindlela ongathola ngazo usizo!

SourceText:
It’s helpful to practice dealing with crisis before something happens. 

Look at these five family crisis times. Imagine you are the parent: What would you do?

Remember:  BREATHE - LISTEN - THINK
text:
Kuyasiza ukukuprakthiza ukubhekana nenkinga engaqubuka ngaphambi kokuba yenzeke. 

Bheka lezi zikhathi ezinhlanu zezinkinga zomndeni. Zicabange uwumzali: Yini obungayenza?

Khumbula:  PHEFUMULA - LALELA - CABANGA

SourceText: Crisis 1: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2 fights at school
text: Inkinga 1: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2 ukulwa esikoleni
note: The string @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2 should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2: "I’ve never done this before. And now they will expel me"
text: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2: “Angikaze ngikwenze lokhu ngaphambili. Njengamanje ngizoxoshwa"
note: The string @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2 should not be translated.

SourceText: Crisis 2: @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 gets pregnant
text: Inkinga 2: @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 uyakhulelwa
note: The string @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: "@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1, I’m so ashamed. I don’t know what to do"
text: @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: "@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1, Ngizizwa nginamahloni. Angazi ukuthi ngenzeni”

SourceText: Crisis 3: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2 makes a girl pregnant
text: Inkinga 3: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2 ukhulelisa intombi
note: The string @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2 should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2: "@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_2, I don’t want to have a baby"
text: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2: "@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_2, Angifuni ukuba nengane"

SourceText: How could you respond to @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2?
text: Ungasabela kanjani ku @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2?
note: The string @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_2 should not be translated.

SourceText: Crisis 4: Someone in the family gets sick
text: Inkinga 4: Othile emndenini uyagula

SourceText: "The test said I have HIV. I’m scared I’m going to die"
text: “Ukuhlolwa kuveze ukuba ngine-HIV. Ngiyesaba ukuthi ngizofa”

SourceText: How could you respond in this situation?
text: Ungasabela kanjani kulesi simo?

SourceText: Crisis 5: @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 is pressured into sex by her boyfriend
text: Inkinga 5: @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 ucindezelwe yisoka lakhe ukuba aye ocansini
note: The string @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: "I didn’t really want to. Now I will get pregnant or be ill. @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver, I’m so scared..."
text: @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: "Bengingafuni ngempela ukuya ocansini. Manje sengizokhulelwa noma ngigule. @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver, Ngiyesaba kakhulu..."

SourceText: How could you respond to @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1?
text: Ungasabela kanjani ku @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1?
note: The string @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 should not be translated.

SourceText: Remember to support and encourage each other. It is hard to remain calm and listen to each other in a crisis - we are proud of you.
text: Khumbulani ukusekelana nokukhuthazana. Kunzima ukuhlale nizolile futhi nilalelana uma kunenkinga - siyaziqhenya ngani.

SourceText:
With your teen choose one of these situations (or think of one yourself!). Look at the cartoon, and discuss what you would do together if this happened to a friend or in your family. 

And remember: BREATHE  - LISTEN - THINK
text:
Wena nengane yakho eseminyakeni yokuthomba khethani isimo esisodwa kulezi (noma ungacabanga esinye!). Buka opopayi, nixoxe ngokuthi nizokwenzani uma lokhu kungenzeka kumngane noma ilungu lomndeni. 

Bese uyakhumbula: PHEFUMULA - LALELA - CABANGA

SourceText: Crisis Examples
text: Izibonelo Zezinkinga

SourceText:
You’ve completed this week’s workshop. 

Next week’s workshop will celebrate you all, and help you plan for the future. 

Why don’t you plan some party food together, and have some music ready if you like to dance!
text:
Ukuqedile ukuqeqeshwa kwaleli viki. 

Ukuqeqeshwa okuzayo kuzobungaza nina nonke, futhi kunisize nihlelele ikusasa. 

Kungani ningahleli ukuba nomcimbi wokudla ndawonye, nilungiselele nomculo uma nithanda ukudansa!

SourceText:
You’ve completed this week’s workshop. 

Next week’s workshop will celebrate you, and you can choose the support you want going forward. 

You can prepare a treat to celebrate – something you like to eat, or music you like to listen to!
text:
Ukuqedile ukuqeqeshwa kwaleli viki. 

Ukuqeqeshwa ngeviki elizayo kuzobe kubungaza wena, futhi ungakhetha ukusekelwa okufunayo ukuqhubekela phambili. 

Ungalungiselela okuthile kokuzithokozisa okungajatshulelwa - okuthile othanda ukukudla, noma umculo othanda ukuwulalela!

SourceText: Wonderful, I am so happy! Keep up the good work.
text: Kuhle kakhulu, ngijabule kakhulu! Qhubeka nokwenza umsebenzi omuhle.

SourceText: Sorry that things are difficult. All families struggle. We are here to help!
text: Ngiyaxolisa ngokuthi isimo sinzima. Yonke imindeni idonsa kanzima. Silapha ukuba sisize!

SourceText: Whatever went ‘wrong’ today, let it go and try again tomorrow. It’s okay!
text: Noma ngabe yini engahambanga kahle namuhla, ungakhathazeki ngayo zama futhi kusasa. Kulungile!

SourceText:
Focus on the positive! 

Telling our teens what we DO want them to do works better than telling them to STOP doing something.

You will see the difference.
text:
Gxila kokuhle! 

Ukutshela intsha yethu ukuthi YINI esifuna iyenze kusebenza kangcono kunokuyitshela ukuthi IYEKE ukwenza okuthile.

Uzowubona umehluko.

SourceText:
Greetings, greetings everyone.

Today our topic is positive instructions. 

It is important to give positive instructions to our children, because when we give them positive instructions they know and understand what we are expecting them to do, and they do it the way we want them to do it. 

So, at the end it keeps everyone happy.
text:
Sanibonani, sanibonani nonke.

Isihloko sethu namuhla sikhuluma ngeziqondiso ezinhle. 

Kubalulekile ukunika izingane zakho iziqondiso ezinhle, ngoba uma uzinikeza iziqondiso ezinhle ziyazi futhi ziqonde ukuthi yini esilindele ukuthi ziyenze, futhi zizokwenza ngendlela esifuna ukuthi zikwenze ngayo. 

Ekugcineni, kwenza wonke umuntu ajabule.

SourceText:
* Thought experiment
* Story & discussion – that didn’t work…
* Story & discussion – that worked!
* Tools: How to give positive instructions
GET REAL - GET POSITIVE - GET CLEAR
* Try it out!
* Home practice suggestions
text:
* Ukuhlola umcabango
* Indatshana kanye nengxoxo – okungasebenzanga ...
* Indatshana kanye nengxoxo – okusebenzile!
* Amathuluzi: Indlela yokunikeza iziqondiso ezinhle
BHEKANA NAMAQINISO - CABANGA NGEZINTO EZAKHAYO - CACISA
* Kuzame!
* Amacebiso alokho ongakwenza ekhaya

SourceText:
* Thought experiment
* Story & reflection – that didn’t work…
* Story & reflection – that worked!
* Tools: How to give positive instructions
GET REAL - GET POSITIVE - GET CLEAR
* Home practice suggestions
text:
* Ukuhlola umcabango
* Indatshana kanye nokucabanga ujule - okungasebenzanga ...
* Indatshana kanye nokucabanga ujule - okusebenzile!
* Amathuluzi: Indlela yokunikeza iziqondiso ezinhle
BHEKANA NAMAQINISO - CABANGA NGEZINTO EZAKHAYO - CACISA
* Amacebiso alokho ongakwenza ekhaya

SourceText: Let’s do a thought experiment!
text: Ake senze ukuhlola okucatshangiwe!

SourceText:
DO NOT THINK ABOUT AN ELEPHANT 

What are you thinking about?
text:
UNGACABANGI NGENDLOVU 

Yini ocabanga ngayo?

SourceText:
You probably DID think about an elephant...

‘Don’t do’ instructions make teens think about that thing. 

Sometimes they don’t understand what we DID want from them. 

Also they often don’t like being told not to do things (don’t we all?)
text:
Ngokuqinisekile kungenzeka UCABANGE ngayo indlovu...

Iziqondiso ezithi ‘ungakwenzi’ yenza intsha icabange ngaleyo nto. 

Ngezinye izikhathi abaqondi ukuthi YINI esifuna bayenze. 

Kanti futhi ngokuvamile abafuni ukutshelwa ukuthi benzeni (cishe kunjalo nangathi sonke.)

SourceText:
NOW, THINK ABOUT A CHEETAH! 

What are you thinking about?
text:
MANJE, CABANGA NGENGULULE! 

Yini ocabanga ngayo?

SourceText:
That’s right! Positive, clear instructions help teens focus on what they should be doing. 

Teens will also feel more respected this way, and are more likely to listen.
text:
Kunjalo! Iziqondiso ezinhle nezicacile zisiza intsha ukuthi igxile kulokho okumelwe ikwenze. 

Uma wenza kanjalo intsha izozizwa ihlonishwa, futhi ithambekele kakhulu ekulaleleni.

SourceText: Let’s see what happens if @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver tells @global.w_instruct_teen_girl "DON'T":
text: Ake sibone ukuthi kwenzekani uma @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver ethi @global.w_instruct_teen_girl "UNGENZI LOKHU":

SourceText:
@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver was cleaning the house while @global.w_instruct_teen_girl was practicing dance moves with her friend.

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: “Don’t make such a mess while I am cleaning the house. You are in the way!”
text:
@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver ubehlanza indlu ngesikhathi @global.w_instruct_teen_girl eprakthiza ukudansa nomngane wakhe.

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: “Ungahlikizi lapho kuyilapho ngisahlanza indlu. Uhamba ngakho!”

SourceText:
@global.w_instruct_teen_girl: “But I need to practice for the school competition. You never let me do anything.”

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: “Don’t you talk back to me!”
text:
@global.w_instruct_teen_girl: “Kodwa kumelwe ngizilungiselele umncintiswano wesikole. Awungivumeli ngenze lutho.”

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: “Ungangiphenduli!”

SourceText:
@global.w_instruct_teen_girl: “Arrg!! Why am I being yelled at all the time????”

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver to herself: “That child is always making trouble.”
text:
@global.w_instruct_teen_girl: “Arrg!! Kungani ngithethiswa njalo????” 

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver ekhuluma yedwa: “Le ngane ihlale idala izinkinga.”

SourceText:
Discuss together: 

* How do you think @global.w_instruct_teen_girl felt about the way @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver responded?  
* What could @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver have done differently?
text:
Xoxani ndawonye: 

* Ucabanga ukuthi @global.w_instruct_teen_girl uzizwe kanjani ngendlela @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver aphendule ngayo?  
* Yini @global.w_instruct_teen_girl abengayenza ngokuhlukile?

SourceText: @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver could have...
text: @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver ubenga...
note: The string @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver should not be translated.

SourceText:
* Said something nice first 
* Spoken to @global.w_instruct_teen_girl in a calm voice 
* Told @global.w_instruct_teen_girl what she wants her to do
text:
* Ubengasho okuthile okuhle kuqala 
* Ubengakhuluma no @global.w_instruct_teen_girl ngezwi elizolile 
* Ubengamtshela @global.w_instruct_teen_girl ukuthi ufuna enzeni

SourceText: How do you think @global.w_instruct_teen_girl felt about the way @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver responded?
text: Ucabanga ukuthi @global.w_instruct_teen_girl uzizwe kanjani ngendlela @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver aphendule ngayo?

SourceText: What could @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver have done differently?
text: Yini @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver abangayenza ngokuhlukile?
note: The string @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver should not be translated.

SourceText: Said something nice first
text: Ubengasho okuthile okuhle kuqala

SourceText: Spoken to @global.w_instruct_teen_girl in a calm voice
text: Ubengakhuluma no @global.w_instruct_teen_girl ngezwi elizolile

SourceText: Told @global.w_instruct_teen_girl what she wants her to do
text: Ubengamtshela @global.w_instruct_teen_girl ukuthi ufuna enzeni

SourceText:
Thank you for thinking along! 

Let’s go back in time and see what happens if @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver gives a positive instruction:
text:
Siyabonga ngokuthi nicabanga kanye nathi! 

Ake sibuyele emuva sibone ukuthi kuzokwenzekani uma @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver enikeza isiqondiso esicacile:
note: The string @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: "Thank you for practicing outside while I finished cleaning, @global.w_instruct_teen_girl. Now I have some time to watch your dance."
text: @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: “Ngiyabonga ngokuthi nidansele ngaphandle njengoba bengiqedela ukuhlanza indlu, @global.w_instruct_teen_girl. Manje nginesikhathi sokuthi ngibukele umdanso wenu.”

SourceText: @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: "Wow, @global.w_instruct_teen_girl! You have such good dance moves!"
text: @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: “Kwaze kwakuhle, @global.w_instruct_teen_girl! Udansa kamnandi ngempela!”

SourceText: Let's discuss what happened this time.
text: Ake sixoxe ngalokho okwenzeke manje.

SourceText:
Discuss together: 

* How did @global.w_instruct_teen_girl and @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver feel now?
* Why do you think the situation went better for @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver this time?
text:
Xoxani ndawonye: 

* U @global.w_instruct_teen_girl no @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver bazizwa kanjani njengamanje?
* Kungani ucabanga ukuthi isimo sibe ngcono @global.w_instruct_teen_girl kulokhu?

SourceText: It worked better this time because...
text: Kusebenze kangcono manje ngoba...

SourceText:
* @global.w_instruct_teen_girl felt respected and loved by her @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver
* @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver was able to stay calm  
* @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver  kept a positive attitude
text:
* @global.w_instruct_teen_girl uzizwe ahlonishwa futhi athandwa u @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver wakhe
* @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver ukwazile ukuhlala ezolile  
* @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver ulondoloze isimo sengqondo esihle

SourceText: How did @global.w_instruct_teen_girl and @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver feel now?
text: U @global.w_instruct_teen_girl no @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver bazizwa kanjani njengamanje?

SourceText: Why do you think the situation went better for @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver this time?
text: Kungani ucabanga ukuthi isimo sibe ngcono @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver kulokhu?
note: The string @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_instruct_teen_girl felt respected and loved by her @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver
text: @global.w_instruct_teen_girl uzizwe ahlonishwa futhi athandwa u @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver wakhe

SourceText: @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver was able to stay calm
text: @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver ukwazile ukuhlala ezolile

SourceText: @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver kept a positive attitude
text: @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver ulondoloze isimo sengqondo esihle

SourceText: Positive instructions can work with your teen too!
text: Ukunikeza iziqondiso ezinhle kungasebenza nasenganeni yakho eseminyakeni yokuthomba!

SourceText: GET REAL
text: BHAKANA NAMAQINISO

SourceText: Can your teen actually do what you are about to ask? It may be impossible for them to read quietly all day, but half an hour when you really need it is realistic.
text: Ingabe ingane yakho eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili izokwenza ngempela yini lokho ozokucela? Kungase kungenzeki ukuthi ifundele phansi usuku lonke, kodwa isigamu sehora uma ubhekana namaqiniso.

SourceText: GET POSITIVE
text: CABANGA NGEZINTO EZAKHAYO

SourceText: Smile, look them in the eye, and use positive words. Praise them as soon as they start to do what you ask!
text: Momotheka, babuke emehlweni, usebenzise amazwi akhuthazayo. Bancome ngokushesha uma beqala ukwenza obacela ukuthi bakwenze!

SourceText: GET  CLEAR
text: CACISA

SourceText: Often we know what we want in our head, but we don’t say it clearly enough. Say exactly what you want your teen to do. Try ‘please come home by 7pm’ instead of ‘come home in time’.
text: Ngokuvamile ezingqondweni zethu siyakwazi esikufunayo, kodwa asikusho kucace ngokwanele. Yisho ngokucacile ukuthi ufuna ingane yakho eseminyakeni yokuthomba yenzeni. Zama ukuthi ‘ngicela ubuye ekhaya ngo-7pm’ kungokuba ‘buya ekhaya ngesikhathi’.

SourceText: Let's practice giving REAL, POSITIVE and CLEAR instructions. Practice will help you be successful with your teen!
text: Ake sizame ukunikeza iziqondiso EZINGOKOQOBO, EZAKHAYO neziCACILE. Ukuprakthiza kuzokusiza wena uphumelele nengane yakho eseminyakeni yokuthomba!

SourceText:
Choose two people from your group:
* One person pretends to be a teenager
* The other pretends to be the teenager’s parent
* “Parent”: Give your “teen” a positive instruction with encouragement and praise
* “Teen”: Respond as you think a teen may respond to this 

Discuss together how that went:
* How did this make you feel as “parent” and as “teen”?
* Could you do anything better?

Give everyone a chance to be the “parent” and the “teen” if you can. Practice brings success!
text:
Khetha abantu ababili eqenjini lakho:
* Omunye enze sengathi uyingane eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili
* Kuthi omunye enze sengathi ungumzali wengane eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili
* “Mzali: Nikeza “ingane eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili” isiqondiso esihle kanye nesikhuthazo esakhayo ngemva kwalokho uyincome
* “Ingane eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili”: Phendula ngendlela ocabanga ukuthi ingane eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili ingaphendula ngayo kulokhu 

Xoxani ndawonye ngokuthi kuhambe kanjani:
* Lokhu kukwenze wazizwa kanjani “njengomzali” “nanjengengane yeyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili”?
* Ingabe kukhona ongakwenza kangcono?

Nikela wonke umuntu ithuba lokuba “umzali” nokuba “umuntu omusha” uma kungenzeka. Ukuprakthiza kuveza imiphumela emihle!

SourceText: Examples of positive instructions:
text: Izibonelo zeziqondiso ezinhle:

SourceText:
* I like your music. Could you turn it down during dinner so that we can talk? Thank you – I really appreciate it. 
* That’s great music. Who is the singer? Please turn the music off when you come in the house. You can play it in your room quietly if you want. Thank you!
text:
* Ngiyawuthanda umculo wakho. Ungakwazi yini ukuwunciphisa ngesikhathi sesidlo sakusihlwa ukuze sikwazi ukuxoxa? Ngiyabonga - ngiyakwazisa kakhulu lokho. 
 * Umnandi umculo wakho. Ubani umculi wawo? Ngicela uwuvale umculo uma ungena endlini. Ungawudlalela phansi ekamelweni lakho uma uthanda. Ngiyabonga!

SourceText:
This week's home practice is to give your teen positive instructions.

Remember – GET REAL, GET POSITIVE, GET CLEAR = GET EXACTLY WHAT YOU WANT (as much as is possible with a teenager!)
text:
Ongakuprakthiza ekhaya kuleli viki ukuthi unikeze ingane yakho isiqondiso esihle.

Khumbula - BHEKANA NAMAQINISO, KHULUMA IZINTO EZAKHAYO, CACISA = THOLA LOKHO OKUFUNAYO (ngendlela okungenzeka ngayo kosemusha!)

SourceText: Caring for yourself is so essential.
text: Ukuzinakekela kubalulekile.

SourceText: Wonderful, I am so happy things are going well. Keep up the good work.
text: Kuhle kakhulu, ngiyajabula ukuthi izinto zikuhambela kahle. Qhubeka nokwenza umsebenzi omuhle.

SourceText: Take a moment and just be impressed at what you’ve achieved, despite all the other things you have to do each day.
text: Thatha isikhashana ujabulele izinto ozenzile, ngaphezu kwazo zonke ezinye ezinto okumelwe uzenze zinsuku zonke.

SourceText:
Many families are stressed about money, especially if teens keep asking for things! 

When we make a budget together, we can agree how to spend AND save to prevent stress and work towards our family’s goals.
text:
Imindeni eminingi ikhathazeke ngemali, ikakhulu uma abantu abasha belokhu bacela izinto! 

Uma senza ibhajethi ndawonye, singavumelana ukuthi siyisebenzisa kanjani imali NOKUTHI siyonge ukuze sigweme ukukhathazeka futhi sisebenzele ukufinyelela imigomo esizibekele yona njengomndeni.

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone. 

Today's topic is family budgeting. 

It is important to create a budget, but it is even more important to create a budget involving the entire family. 

Doing it together helps increase the level of understanding of how you spend money as a family and how much you save for the family, and you can even come up with plans of how you can save as a family.
text:
Sanibonani, nonke. 

Isihloko sanamuhla ibhajethi yomndeni. 

Kubalulekile ukwenza ibhajethi, kodwa okubaluleke nakakhulu ukwenza isabelomali esihlanganisa umndeni wonke. 

Ukuyenza ndawonye kukhulisa izinga lokuqonda indlela imali esentshenziswa ngayo njengomndeni nokuthi malini ozowongela umndeni wakho, ungaze wenze nezinhlelo zokuthi nizoyonga kanjani imali njengomndeni.

SourceText:
* Story – that didn’t work… 
* Budgeting exercise
* Story & discussion – that worked!
* Story & discussion – that didn’t work…
* Discussion on saving options
* Saving exercise
* Tools: How to budget & save
THINK - CHOOSE - BUILD - PLAN
* Home practice suggestions
text:
* Indatshana – lokho akusebenzanga… 
* Ukufunda ukwenza isabelomali
* Indatshana kanye nengxoxo – okusebenzile!
* Indatshana kanye nengxoxo – okungasebenzanga ...
* Ingxoxo ngezindlela zokonga imali
* Ukufunda ukonga imali
* Amathuluzi: Indlela yokwenza isabelomali kanye nokonga
CABANGA - KHETHA - YAKHA - HLELA
* Amacebiso alokho ongakwenza ekhaya

SourceText:
It can be hard to make ends meet every month. Many families have this problem! 

Including @global.w_money_grandma - let's have a look:
text:
Kungaba nzima ukuthola zonke izinto ozidingayo nyanga zonke. Imindeni eminingi inale nkinga! 

Kuhlanganise @global.w_money_grandma - Ake sibone:
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_money_grandma: "I have been taking care of my grandchildren, @global.w_money_teen_girl and @global.w_money_teen_boy, since their parents died when they were young. We often struggle with money, as I only receive a small grant."
text: @global.w_money_grandma: “Bengilokhu nginakekela abazukulu bami, @global.w_money_teen_girl no @global.w_money_teen_boy, njengoba abazali babo bashona besebancane. Ngokuvamile siba nezinkinga zemali, njengoba ngithola kuphela imali yesibonelelo sikahulumeni esincane.”

SourceText: @global.w_money_grandma: "I am so stressed. I don’t have any money left. And now I’m fighting with my teens over things they want – again."
text: @global.w_money_grandma: “Ngicindezeleke kakhulu. Ayikho enye imali esele. Futhi manje siyaxabana nezingane zami ngezinto ezizifunayo futhi.”
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma should not be translated.

SourceText:
There are four steps for doing a family budget: 

Step 1: THINK
Step 2: CHOOSE
Step 3: BUILD
Step 4: PLAN

Let’s go through the steps together. You need:

- Papers (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) and pens
- Stones or beans or anything with lots of bits to represent money
 
Take a minute to get these things before we start with the first step.
text:
Kunezinyathelo ezine zokwenza ibhajethi yomndeni: 

Isinyathelo 1: CABANGA
Isinyathelo 2: KHETHA
Isinyathelo 3: YAKHA
Isinyathelo 4: HLELA

Ake sizihlole ndawonye lezi zinyathelo. Udinga:

- Amaphepha (noma iphephandaba elidala noma ikhadibhodi) kanye namapeni
- Amatshe noma obhontshisi noma kungaba yinoma yini eyizingcezu ezomelela imali
 
 Thatha umzuzu uthole lezi zinto ngaphambi kokuthi uqale ngesinyathelo sokuqala.

SourceText: A family budget can help @global.w_money_grandma - and YOU!
text: Isabelomali somndeni singasiza @global.w_money_grandma - sisize NAWE!
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma should not be translated.

SourceText: Think about what we spend money on each month.
text: Cabanga ngokuthi siyisebenzisela ini imali inyanga nenyanga.

SourceText:
* Get a piece of paper (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) and a pen. 
* Draw pictures of all the things that you and your family spend money on each month. 
* Write next to each picture how much each thing costs each month. (There is no need to share the numbers if you don’t want to.)
* Add up how much money you have to spend each month.
text:
* Thola isiqeshana sephepha (noma iphephandaba elidala noma ikhadibhodi) kanye nepeni. 
* Dweba izithombe zazo zonke izinto wena nomndeni wakho enichitha imali kuzo ngenyanga. 
* Bhala eceleni kwesithombe ngasinye ukuthi into ngayinye ibiza malini inyanga ngayinye. (Akudingeki ubhale inani lemali uma ungafuni ukwenza njalo.)
* Hlanganisa inani lemali enilisebenzisayo inyanga ngayinye.

SourceText:
Wonderful! You finished step 1! 

Let’s move on!
text:
Kuhle kakhulu! Usiqedile isinyathelo 1! 

Asiqhubeke!

SourceText:
Talk together about your needs and wants

WANT: Something you can live without
NEED: Something you cannot live without
text:
Khulumisanani ngezidingo zenu nezinto enizifunayo 

OKUFUNAYO: Izinto ongaphila ngaphandle kwazo 
ISIDINGO: Izinto ongeke uphile ngaphandle kwazo

SourceText:
People often don’t see things in the same way. When we talk about our needs and wants, we understand each other better and can make good choices together on how to spend our money.

Look at your lists of things you spend money on and discuss:
* Which are NEEDS that you can’t live without? Why?
* Which are WANTS which are nice to have but not essential? Why? 
* Which things could you try to spend less money on as a family?
text:
Ngokuvamile abantu ababoni izinto ngendlela efanayo. Uma sikhuluma ngezinto esizidingayo kanye nesizifunayo, siqondana kancono futhi senze izinqumo ezinhle ezimayelana nokuthi sizoyisebenzisa kanjani imali yethu.

Bheka uhlu lwezinto osebenzisa imali kuzo bese niyaxoxa: 
*Yiziphi EZIYISIDINGO esingeke sikwazi ukuphila ngaphandle kwazo? Kungani?
* Yiziphi ESIZIFUNAYO okumnandi ukuba nazo kodwa ezingabalulekile? Kungani? 
* Yiziphi izinto eningazama ukusebenzisa imali encane kuzo njengomndeni?

SourceText:
Think about your needs and wants

WANT: Something you can live without
NEED: Something you cannot live without
text:
Cabanga ngezidingo nezinto ozifunayo 

OKUFUNAYO: Izinto ongaphila ngaphandle kwazo 
ISIDINGO: Izinto ongeke uphile ngaphandle kwazo

SourceText:
Look at your list of things you spend money on and choose:
* Which are NEEDS that you can’t live without? Why?
* Which are WANTS which are nice to have but not essential? Why? 
* Which things could you try to spend less money on?
text:
Bheka uhlu lwezinto osebenzisa imali kuzo bese uyakhetha: 
*Yiziphi EZIYISIDINGO esingeke sikwazi ukuphila ngaphandle kwazo? Kungani?
* Yiziphi ESIZIFUNAYO okumnandi ukuba nazo kodwa ezingabalulekile? Kungani? 
* Yiziphi izinto eningazama ukusebenzisa imali encane kuzo?

SourceText: Make a budget!
text: Yenza isabelomali!

SourceText: Make a budget as one big family!
text: Yenzani isabelomali njengomndeni owodwa omkhulu!

SourceText:
* One person will volunteer to share his/her list (If no one volunteers you can make a new list together) 
* Take roles - some will be adults, some will be teens. 
* Decide what your income is for the month.
* Take some stones or beans or anything with lots of bits - this is your income for the month. 
(For example: If your income is @global.currency@local.monthly_income, and you have @local.number_of_beans beans, each bean is @global.currency@local.bean_value.)  
* Decide together what you will spend on what, and put the stones/objects on that image. 

Not sure about your decisions? Having trouble deciding between "needs" and "wants"? That’s totally fine!
text:
* Umuntu oyedwa uzovolontiyela ukuveza olwakhe uhlu (uma engekho ofuna ukuvolontiya ningenza uhlu olusha ndawonye) 
* Thathani izindima - abanye bazoba abantu abadala, kuthi abanye baba abantu abasha. 
* Khetha ukuthi uzoba yimalini umholo wakho wenyanga.
* Thathani amatshe noma ubhontshisi nanoma yini enezingcezu eziningi - lokhu kuzoba umholo wakho wenyanga. 
(Ngokwesibonelo: Uma umholo wakho ungu-@global.currency@local.monthly_income, kodwa unobhontshisi abangu-@local.number_of_beans, ubhontshisi owodwa uzoba ngu-@global.currency@local.bean_value.)  
* Yenza isinqumo ndawonye sokuthi malini enizoyisebenzisela ini, bese nibeka amatshe/okuthile kuleso sithombe. 

Aniqiniseki ngesinqumo sakho? Nikuthola kunzima ukunquma ukuthi yiziphi izinto “enizidingayo” kanye ”nenizifunayo”? Lokho akunankinga ngempela!

SourceText: Make a budget as a family!
text: Yenzani isabelomali njengomndeni!

SourceText:
* Write down what your income is for the month.
* Take some stones or beans or anything with lots of bits - this is your income for the month. 
(For example: If your income is @global.currency@local.monthly_income, and you have @local.number_of_beans beans, each bean is @global.currency@local.bean_value.)
* Decide what you will spend on what, and put the stones/objects on that image. 

Not sure about your decisions? Having trouble deciding between "needs" and "wants"? That’s totally fine!
text:
* Bhala phansi ukuthi uzoba yimalini umholo wakho wenyanga.
* Thathani amatshe noma ubhontshisi nanoma yini enezingcezu eziningi - lokhu kuzoba umholo wakho wenyanga. 
(Ngokwesibonelo: Uma umholo wakho ungu-@global.currency@local.monthly_income, kodwa unobhontshisi abangu-@local.number_of_beans, ubhontshisi owodwa uzoba ngu-@global.currency@local.bean_value.)
* Yenza isinqumo ukuthi malini uzoyisebenzisela ini, bese ubeka amatshe/okuthile kuleso sithombe. 

Aniqiniseki ngesinqumo sakho? Nikuthola kunzima ukunquma ukuthi yiziphi izinto “enizidingayo” kanye ”nenizifunayo”? Lokho akunankinga ngempela!

SourceText:
Great work, you have completed the first 3 steps! 

Let's see how @global.w_money_grandma made a plan with her money, just like you are doing:
text:
Nenze umsebenzi omuhle, seniqede izinyathelo ezi-3 zokuqala! 

Ake sibone ukuthi @global.w_money_grandma ulwenze kanjani uhlelo lokusebenzisa imali yakhe, njengoba nje wenza:
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma should not be translated.

SourceText:
"I want the best future for my grandchildren, but I don’t know where to get the money. Loan sharks are dangerous and paying them back is so expensive. 

I should save, but that feels impossible!"
text:
“Ngifunela abazukulu bami ikusasa elihle, kodwa angazi ukuthi ngizoyithola kuphi imali. Ukuboleka imali komashonisa kuyingozi kanti futhi kuyabiza ukuyikhokha. 

Kumelwe ngonge, kodwa lokho kubonakala kungeke kwenzeke!”

SourceText: "My goal is to make sure my grandson can go to high school and my granddaughter can reach her dream of university. How can I save a lot of money with the little money I have?"
text: “Umgomo wami ukuthi umzukulu wami womfana aye esikoleni samabanga aphezulu bese kuthi umzukulu wami wentombazane aye enyuvesi. Ngingakwazi kanjani ukonga imali eningi ngemadlana yami encane enginayo?”

SourceText: "I know - let’s start with a plan! First, let me make a budget – a plan for how I can save my money. Then I will save just a little bit of money at a time – I will even join a savings and loans group."
text: “Ngiyazi - ake siqale ngokuhlela! Okokuqala, ake ngenze isabelomali - uhlelo lokuthi ngizoyonga kanjani imali yami. Ngemva kwalokho ngizokonga imali encane ngesikhathi - ngizophinde ngijoyine namaqembu okonga imali nokubolekisa.”

SourceText: "I should also speak with my grandchildren to choose things that we can spend just a little bit less on each week. They will help me think of things we want but don’t need."
text: “Ngizophinde ngikhulume nabazukulu bami sikhethe izinto esizosebenzisa imali encani kuzona njalo ngeviki. Bazongisiza ngicabange ngezinto esizifunayo kodwa esingazidingi.”

SourceText:
A few years later:

"Look, we reached our dreams! I didn’t borrow any money from friends or loan sharks. By saving a tiny bit each week, I managed to pay for @global.w_money_teen_boy’s high school and save some money for @global.w_money_teen_girl’s university. I am so proud of this.”
text:
Ngemva kweminyaka embalwa kamuva:

“Bheka, sesiwafinyelele amaphupho ethu! Ayikho imali engiyiboleke kubangane noma komashonisa. Ngokonga okuncane iviki neviki, ngikwazile ukukhokhela u-@global.w_money_teen_boy esikolweni samabanga aphakeme futhi ngonga nemali ka-@global.w_money_teen_girl yokufunda enyuvesi. Ngiyaziqhenya ngalokhu.”

SourceText: What are your  family savings goals?
text: Uyini umgomo wokonga womndeni wakho?

SourceText:
Such great goals! 

Such a great goal! When we make a good budget and saving plan together, we can achieve it and feel proud of ourselves!
text:
Imigomo emihle leyo! 

Umgomo omuhle loyo! Uma senza isabelomali esihle bese sihlela indlela yokonga imali ndawonye, singakwazi ukuyifinyelela bese siyaziqhenya ngathi!

SourceText: We all have dreams for our family, just like @global.w_money_grandma. By setting aside a bit of money every month, you can realise them too!
text: Sonke sinamaphupho ngemindeni yethu, njengo @global.w_money_grandma. Ngokubekela eceleni imali encane inyanga nenyanga, ungawafinyelela lawo maphupho!
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma should not be translated.

SourceText: What are your family savings goals?
text: Uyini umgomo wokonga womndeni wakho?

SourceText:
Such a great goal! 

By making a good budget and saving plan, you can achieve it and feel proud of yourself!
text:
Umgomo omuhle loyo! 

Ngokwenza isabelomali esihle kanye nohlelo lokonga, ungakwazi ukuyifinyelela bese uziqhenya ngawe!

SourceText: Saving is important for one more reason: emergencies! @global.w_money_grandma also learned this along the way:
text: Esinye isizathu esengeziwe esenza ukonga kubaluleke: izimo eziphuthumayo! @global.w_money_grandma uye wakufunda lokhu njengoba siqhubeka:
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma should not be translated.

SourceText: “One night there was a horrible storm that broke my roof. Everything was flooded. I suddenly had to find money to fix the roof. I just felt defeated.”
text: “Ngelinye ilanga kwaba nemvula enkulu eyalimaza uphahla lwami. Kwakhukhuleka yonke into. Kwadingeka ngithole imali ngokushesha ukuze ngilungise uphahla. Ngazizwa ngiphelelwe ngamandla.”

SourceText: Let's talk about this story.
text: Ake sikhulume ngale ndaba.

SourceText:
For @global.w_money_grandma, a storm happened. 

What other emergencies could come up for us?
text:
Ku @global.w_money_grandma, kwaba nemvula enamandla. 

Iziphi ezinye izimo eziphuthumayo ezingasehlela?
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma should not be translated.

SourceText: Let's think about this story.
text: Ake sicabange ngale ndaba.

SourceText: For @global.w_money_grandma, a storm happened.
text: Ku @global.w_money_grandma, kwaba nemvula enamandla.
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma should not be translated.

SourceText: What other emergencies could come up for your family?
text: Yisiphi esinye isimo esiphuthumayo esingavelela imindeni yethu?

SourceText: Emergencies can happen in any family. Saving some money for these emergencies BEFORE they happen prevents a lot of sudden worry and stress!
text: Isimo esiphuthumayo singavelela noma imuphi umndeni. Ukonga imali yokusiza uma kuvela isimo esiphuthumayo NGAPHAMBI kokuthi siqubuke kuzovimbela ukukhathazeka kungalindelekile nokucindezeleka!

SourceText: Let's talk about different ways we can save.
text: Ake sikhulume ngezindlela ezihlukahlukene zokonga.

SourceText:
Discuss together: 
* In which different ways can we save?  
* What are the advantages and disadvantages of each savings option? 

Understanding each option well will help you to decide what is the best saving option for your family.  

Whatever savings plan you choose, it will really help your family move forward!
text:
Xoxani ndawonye: 
* Imali singayonga ngaziphi izindlela ezihlukahlukene?  
Yibuphi ubuhle nobubi bendlela ngayinye yokonga? 

Ukuqonda indlela ngayinye kuzokusiza unqume ukuthi iyiphi indlela engcono yokonga elungele umndeni wakho.  

Noma ngabe iyiphi indlela yokonga oyikhethayo, izosiza umndeni wakhe uqhubekele phambili!

SourceText: Let's think about different ways we can save.
text: Ake sicabange ngezindlela ezihlukahlukene esingonga ngazo.

SourceText:
There are different ways we can save: at home, buying things we can sell later, at a bank, or in a savings group.

Think of the advantages and disadvantages of each savings option.
text:
Kunezindlela ezihlukahlukene esingakwazi ngazo ukonga: ekhaya, ukuthenga izinto esingakwazi ukuzithengisa kamuva, ebhange, noma eqenjini lokonga.

Cabanga ngobuhle nobubi bendlela ngayinye yokonga.

SourceText: What is the best savings option for your family?
text: Iyiphi indlela yokonga engcono elungele umndeni wakho?

SourceText: Whatever savings plan you choose, it will really help your family move forward!
text: Noma ngabe iyiphi indlela yokonga oyikhethayo, izosiza umndeni wakhe uqhubekele phambili!

SourceText: Plan how you can save money, so you can deal with emergencies and realise your family goals!
text: Hlela ukuthi uzoyonga kanjani imali, ukuze ukwazi ukubhekana nezimo eziphuthumayo ezivelayo futhi ufinyelele imigomo yomndeni wakho!

SourceText:
If you can save even a tiny amount for the future or emergency - it can make a big difference over time. 
* Add a circle called “emergencies”.
* Add a circle called “family goals”.
* Now try to move your money around so you can save a bit every month for each of these.
text:
Uma ungakwazi ukonga ngisho noma okuncane ozokusebenzisa esikhathini esizayo noma ezimweni eziphuthumayo - kungenza umehluko omkhulu ngokuhamba kwesikhathi. 
* Faka indilinga ebizwa ngokuthi “izimo eziphuthumayo”.
* Faka indilinga ebizwa ngokuthi “imigomo yomndeni”.
* Manje zama ukuhlela imali yakho ukuze wonge okuncane nyanga zonke ezintweni ozikhokhelayo.

SourceText: CONGRATULATIONS!!! You’ve made your family budget – and using it will make a huge difference for you. I think every person in your group deserves a praise, don’t you?
text: SIYAKUHALALISELA!!! Wenze isabelomali somndeni wakho - ukusisebenzisa kuzokwenza umehluko omkhulu. Ngicabanga ukuthi wonke umuntu eqenjini lakho ufanelwe ukunconywa, akunjalo?

SourceText: CONGRATULATIONS!!! You’ve made your family budget – and using it will make a huge difference for you. I think every person in your family deserves a praise, don’t you?
text: SIYAKUHALALISELA!!! Wenze isabelomali somndeni wakho - ukusisebenzisa kuzokwenza umehluko omkhulu. Ngicabanga ukuthi wonke umuntu emndenini wakho ufanelwe ukunconywa, akunjalo?

SourceText: CONGRATULATIONS!!! You’ve made your budget – remember to do this exercise again with your other family members - if you agree on a plan together it will make a huge difference!
text: SIYAKUHALALISELA!!! Wenze isabelomali sakho - khumbula ukuphinde wenze lesi sivivinyo futhi namalungu womndeni wakho - uma nivumelana ndawonye ngohlelo kuzokwenza umehluko omkhulu!

SourceText: Step 1: THINK
text: Isinyathelo 1: CABANGA

SourceText: What do we spend on now?
text: Siyisebenzisa kuphi imali njengamanje?

SourceText: THINK Activity
text: CABANGA Umsebenzi

text: Isinyathelo 2: KHETHA

text: Khulumani ngezidingo kanye nezimfuno ndawonye

SourceText: CHOOSE Activity
text: KHETHA Umsebenzi

text: Isinyathelo 3: YAKHA

SourceText: Make your own budget
text: Zakhele isabelomali sakho

SourceText: BUILD Activity
text: YAKHA Umsebenzi

SourceText: Step 4: PLAN
text: Isinyathelo 4: HLELA

SourceText: Emergencies and family goals
text: Izimo eziphuthumayo nemigomo yomndeni

SourceText: PLAN Activity
text: HLELA Umsebenzi

SourceText:
Make a budget again - this time WITH your teen and family! 

This is an important and fun thing to do with your family - it takes about 30 minutes.

Making a budget together helps teens understand that we all need to make hard decisions sometimes - but that it helps us have enough money at the end of the month and realise our goals!

Budgets have helped  millions of families.
text:
Yenza isabelomali futhi - manje senze KANYE nengane yakho eseminyakeni yokuthomba kanye nomndeni wakho! 

Lena yinto ebalulekile nokumnandi ukuyenza nomndeni - kungathatha imizuzu engaba ngu-30.

Ukwenza isabelomali njengomndeni kusiza intsha iqonde ukuthi ngezinye izikhathi sonke kudingeka senze izinqumo ezinzima - kodwa lokho kusisiza sibe nemali eyanele ekupheleni kwenyanga futhi sikwazi ukufinyelela imigomo yethu!

Isabelomali sisize izigidi zemindeni.

SourceText:
Make a budget with your teen and family. 

This is an important and fun thing to do with your family - it takes about 30 minutes.

Making a budget together helps teens understand that we all need to make hard decisions sometimes - but that it helps us have enough money at the end of the month and realise our goals!

Budgets have helped  millions of families.
text:
Yenza isabelomali nosemusha kanye nomndeni wakho. 

Lena yinto ebalulekile nokumnandi ukuyenza nomndeni - kungathatha imizuzu engaba ngu-30.

Ukwenza isabelomali njengomndeni kusiza intsha iqonde ukuthi ngezinye izikhathi sonke kudingeka senze izinqumo ezinzima - kodwa lokho kusisiza sibe nemali eyanele ekupheleni kwenyanga futhi sikwazi ukufinyelela imigomo yethu!

Isabelomali sisize izigidi zemindeni.

SourceText:
Review your budget with your teen and family. This will remind everyone that we all need to make hard decisions sometimes - but that it helps us have enough money at the end of the month and realise our goals!

Budgets have helped millions of families.
text:
Buyekeza isabelomali nentshakanye nomndeni wakho. Ukwenza kanjalo kuzokhumbuza wonke umuntu sidinga ukwenza izinqumo ezinzima ngezinye izikhathi - kodwa lokho kusisiza sibe nemali eyanele ekupheleni kwenyanga futhi sikwazi ukufinyelela imigomo yethu!

Isabelomali sisize izigidi zemindeni.

SourceText: Steps to make a budget
text: Izinyathelo zokwenza isabelomali

SourceText: Great to hear that you are doing well. You are a wonderful parent!
text: Ngiyajabula ukwazi ukuthi kukuhambela kahle. Ungumzali omangalisayo!

SourceText: Sorry that you are not having the best day. Well done for trying to figure everything out. Nobody has all the answers but you really do your best!
text: Ngiyaxolisa ngokuthi usuku lwakho aluhambi kahle. Wenza kahle ngokuzama ukwazi ngalokhu. Akekho umuntu onezimpendulo zayo yonke imibuzo kodwa wenza konke okusemandleni akho!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are not having a good day. Well done for getting up every morning and trying again, even when you are tired. That is real courage and dedication!
text: Ngiyaxolisa ukuzwa ukuthi usuku lwakho aluhambi kahle. Wenza kahle ngokuthi uvuke njalo ekuseni ukuze uzame futhi, ngisho noma ukhathele. Lokhu kubonisa isibindi nokuzinikela!

SourceText: Step 1: Share what went well and what was hard
text: Isinyathelo 1: Khuluma ngokuhambe kahle nokube nzima

SourceText: "I learned so much more about my teen’s life when we spent one-on-one time! But after the first day, my teen only wanted to play on his phone."
text: “Ngafunda okuningi ngokuphila kwentsha yami ngesikhathi sichitha isikhathi ndawonye! Kodwa ngemva kosuku lokuqala, ingane yami esanda kweva eminyakeni eyishumi nambili ibifuna ukudlala ngefoni yayo kuphela.”

SourceText: Step 2: Bring ideas!
text: Isinyathelo 2: Veza amacebo!

SourceText:
"Well done for trying! Maybe you could suggest some other fun things you could do together with your teen."

"Yes, or you could do something together on his phone? Or he could show you how his phone works?"
text:
“Wenze kahle ngokuzama! Mhlawumbe ungasikisela ezinye izinto ezimnandi eningazenza ndawonye nengane yakho eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili. 

“Yebo, noma ningenza okuthile kumakhalekhukhwini wakhe ndawonye? Noma angakubonisa ukuthi ifoni yakhe isebenza kanjani?”

SourceText: Step 3: Pick and try one!
text: Isinyathelo 3: Khetha bese uzama okukodwa!

SourceText: “Thank you for those great ideas! Yes, let me ask my teen to show how his phone works tomorrow after school. Can one of you pretend to be my teen now, so I can practice asking?”
text: “Ngiyabonga ngala macebiso amahle! Yebo, ake ngicele ingane yami eseyintsha ingibonise ukuthi ifoni yayo isebenza kanjani kusasa ngemva kwesikole. Ngicela manje omunye kini azenze ingane yami eseyintsha, ukuze ngikwazi ukuprakthizela ukumcela?”

SourceText:
Think about how your home activities went this week. 

Take turns to discuss:

* What went well and what was a problem?
* What solutions can you think of together?
* Pick one solution and try it later with your teen! 

(Or you can even practice it now  so it will be easier later!)
text:
Cabanga ngokuthi imisebenzi yakho yasekhaya ihambe kanjani kuleli sonto. 

Nikanani amathuba okuxoxa:

* Yini ehambe kahle futhi yini ebe yinkinga?
* Yiziphi izixazululo eningazicabanga ndawonye?
* Khetha isixazululo esisodwa bese uyasizama kamuva nengane yakho eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili! 

(Noma ungayiprakthiza khona manje ukuze kube lula kamuva!)

SourceText:
Praise is a powerful parenting skill.

If we praise our teens when they do something well, we will see them do more and more positive things!
text:
Ukuncoma kuyikhono elinamandla lokuba umzali.

Uma sincoma intsha yethu uma yenze okuthile okuhle, sizoyibona yenza izinto ezingeziwe ezinhle!

SourceText:
Greetings everyone. 

Our topic today is about praise. 

It is good to praise our children when they've done good because when we do that, they will do more of that good behavior we want to see. 

And let's not forget to praise ourselves when we do good too!
text:
Sanibonani nonke. 

Isihloko sethu sanamuhla sikhuluma ngokuncoma. 

Kuyinto enhle ukuncoma intsha yethu uma yenze kahle ngoba uma senza kanjalo, zizokwenza okungeziwe okuhle esifuna ukukubona. 

Futhi asingakhohlwa ukuzincoma nathi uma senze kahle!

SourceText:

* Story & discussion – that worked!
* Tools: How to praise

* Try it out!
* Home practice suggestions
text:
* Imithelela yokuncoma

* Amacebiso alokho ongakwenza ekhaya

SourceText:
Share with each other:

* When last did someone thank you or say you did something great? 
* How did it make you feel? 
* How does it feel if you are not thanked or praised for what you do? 

We usually don’t get thanked or praised enough as parents. Maybe you can give your teens the right example and praise them first when they do something well!
text:
Xoxelanani:

* Ugcine nini ukubongwa othile noma othile athi uyenze kahle into ethile? 
* Kwakwenza wazizwa kanjani? 
* Uzizwa kanjani uma ungabongwa noma unconywe ngokuthile okwenzayo? 

Ngokuvamile asibongwa noma sinconywe ngokwanele njengabazali. Mhlawumbe singabekela intsha yethu isibonelo esihle ngokuthi siyincome kuqala uma yenze kahle okuthile!

SourceText: Think about the last time someone thanked you, or said you did something great.
text: Cabanga ngesikhathi lapho othile akubonga, noma wathi wenze into enhle.

SourceText: How did it make you feel?
text: Kwakwenza wazizwa kanjani?

SourceText: Parents usually don’t get thanked or praised enough.
text: Ngokuvamile abazali ababongwa noma banconywe ngokwanele.

SourceText: How does it make you feel when nobody says "thank you"?
text: Kukwenza uzizwe kanjani uma kungekho muntu othi “ngiyabonga”?

SourceText: Tired
text: Ukhathele

SourceText: Your teen can feel this way too. That's what makes this week's parenting tool simple but important: Praise them for what they do right.
text: Intsha yakho nayo ingase izizwe ngalendlela. Yilokho okwenza ithuluzi lokuba umzali laleli viki libe elibalulekile kodwa elilula: Bancome ngezinto ezinhle abazenzayo.

SourceText:
Praise really is powerful. 

Let’s look at the example of @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name and her daughters:
text:
Ngempela ukuncoma kunamandla. 

Ake sibone isibonelo sika @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name nendodakazi yakhe:
note: The string @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name should not be translated.

SourceText: When @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name is busy, her two daughters often fight. But today, her older daughter actually helped her sister with her schoolwork!
text: Ngesikhathi u @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name ematasa, ngokuvamile amadodakazi akhe amabili ayalwa. Kodwa namuhla, indodakazi yakhe indala isize udadewabo ngomsebenzi wesikole!
note: The string @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name: "Thank you for doing your schoolwork, @global.w_praise_girl, and thank you for helping your sister,  @global.w_praise_teen_girl. I'm so proud of you!"
text: @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name: "Ngiyabonga ngokuthi wenze umsebenzi wakho wesikole, @global.w_praise_girl, ngiyabonga ngokuthi usize udadewenu, @global.w_praise_teen_girl. Ngiyaziqhenya kakhulu ngani!"

SourceText: Let's discuss this story.
text: Ake sixoxe ngale ndaba.

SourceText:
Discuss together:

* How did praise make @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name's teens feel?
* Why did she praise them?
text:
Xoxani ndawonye:

* Ukunconywa kwenze izingane zika-@global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name ezevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili zazizwa kanjani?
* Kungani eye wazincoma?
note: The string @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name praised her teens...
text: @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name uncome izingane zakhe ezevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili...
note: The string @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name should not be translated.

SourceText:
* To get them to do it more often
* To help her finish her work 
* To make them feel good 
* To make herself feel good
text:
* Ukuze azenze zikwenze ngokwengeziwe
* Ukuze amsize aqedele umsebenzi wakhe 
* Ukuze azenze zizizwe zijabule 
* Ukuze azizwe ejabule

SourceText: How did praise make @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name's teens feel?
text: Ukunconywa kwenze izingane zika-@global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name ezisezintsha zazizwa kanjani?
note: The string @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Why did she praise them?
text: Kungani aye wazincoma?

SourceText: To get them to do it more often
text: Ukuze abenze bakwenze ngokwengeziwe

SourceText: To help her finish her work
text: Ukuze amsize aqedele umsebenzi wakhe

SourceText: To make them feel good
text: Ukubenza bazizwe bejabule

SourceText: To make herself feel good
text: Ukuze azizwe ejabule

SourceText:
All of those things are true! 

When her teens are happy, @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name feels happy. And she got her work done.
text:
Zonke lezi zinto ziyiqiniso! 

Uma intsha yakhe ijabule, @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name uyajabula. Futhi ukwaze ukuqeda umsebenzi wakhe.
note: The string @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name should not be translated.

SourceText: The same can work for you!
text: Nawe kungakusebenzela lokhu!

SourceText: SEE IT
text: KUBONE

SourceText: Look for anything your teen does that is helpful or good, and praise them for it. They may not show it, but you’ll see them doing that good thing again. It will also reassure them that you notice and care.
text: Funa okuthile ingane yakho eseminyakeni yokuthomba ekwenzayo okuwusizo noma okuhle, bese uyayincoma. Kungenzeka zingakubonisi kona, kodwa uzozibona ziphinde zikwenza lokho okuhle futhi. Kuzobaqinisekisa ukuthi uyakubona futhi uyabakhathalela.

SourceText: SAY IT
text: KUSHO

SourceText: Be enthusiastic – really mean it when you say it!
text: Yiba nentshiseko - yiba qotho kulokho okushoyo!

SourceText: REPEAT IT
text: KUPHINDE

SourceText: Try to find something to thank them for every day. Even something really small.
text: Zama ukuthola okuthile ongayibonga ngakho usuku nosuku. Ngisho nento encane kakhulu.

SourceText: You can also praise other adults in your household, too. Notice how they respond!
text: Ungaphinde uncome nabanye asebebadala endlini yakho. Qaphela indlela abasabela ngayo!

SourceText: Let's practice giving praise.
text: Ake sikwenze umkhuba ukuncoma.

SourceText:
Share with each other: 

* What can you praise your teen for? 
* What has someone else done well during this workshop? Tell them!
* How did it make you feel to praise someone?
* How did it make you feel to be praised?
text:
Khulumisanani: 

* Yisiphi isizathu esingakwenza uncome ingane yakho eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili? 
* Yini othile ayenze kahle phakathi nalokhu kuqeqeshwa? Batshele! 
* Kukwenze wazizwa kanjani lapho uncoma omunye umuntu? 
* Kukwenza wazizwa kanjani lapho unconywa?

SourceText: Sometimes it’s hard to think of what to praise your teen for! Here are some ideas from other parents:
text: Ngezinye izikhathi kunzima ukucabanga ukuthi yini ongancoma intsha yakho ngakho! Nakhu okunye ukusikisela okuvela kwabanye abazali:

SourceText:
* Being kind to someone 
* Cleaning their room 
* Joining a family meal 
* Greeting other family members 
* Looking after siblings 
* Coming home in time 
* Showing thoughtfulness 
* Saying 'please' or 'thank you' 
* Going to school  
* Doing chores or schoolwork  
* Getting through mealtime peacefully
text:
* Ukuba nomusa kothile 
* Ukuhlanza igumbi lakhe 
* Ukuhlanganyela esidlweni somndeni 
* Ukubingelela amanye amalungu omndeni 
* Ukunakekela ozalwa nabo 
* Ukufika ekhaya ngesikhathi 
* Ukubonisa ukucabangela 
* Ukuthi 'ngiyacela' noma 'ngiyabonga' 
* Ukuya esikoleni  
* Ukwenza imisebenzi yasekhaya noma ukwenza umsebenzi wesikole wasekhaya  
* Ukudla ngokuthula

SourceText: This week's home practice is to praise your teen once a day. It will only take 10 seconds!
text: Umsebenzi ozowuprakthiza ekhaya kuleli viki ukuncoma ingane yakho eseminyakeni yokuthomba kanye ngosuku. Kuzothatha imizuzwana eyishumi nje kuphela!

SourceText: Remember that YOU matter!
text: Khumbula ukuthi UWENA obalulekile!

SourceText: Well done for recognising a positive feeling. I am happy to hear you are feeling well today!
text: Usebenzile ngokuthi ubone imizwa emihle. Ngiyajabula ukuthi uzizwa kahle namuhla!

SourceText: Well done for recognising a difficult feeling. It’s okay not to be okay sometimes. Remember you are not alone.
text: Usebenzile ngokuthi ubone imizwa enzima. Kulungile ukungazizwa kahle ngezinye izikhathi. Khumbula ukuthi awuwedwa.

SourceText: This is just incredible. Every one of these habits is making your family stronger. Be proud.
text: Kuhle kakhulu lokhu. Ngayinye yale mikhuba yenza umndeni wakho uqine. Ziqhenye.

SourceText:
Rules help teens understand what is expected from them. 

Teens are more likely to follow rules if you create the rules WITH your teen and praise them for it!
text:
Imithetho yenza intsha iqonde ukuthi yini elindeleke kuyo. 

Intsha iyathanda ukulandela imithetho uma wenze imithetho NAYO futhi uyincome ngalokho!

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone. 

Today's topic is rules. 

Rules promote peace within the household and promote understanding amongst family members. 

Rules promote responsibilities for each family member; therefore, it is important to have family rules. 

A household with family rules lives in peace.
text:
Sanibonani, nonke. 

Isihloko sanamuhla imithetho. 

Imithetho ikhuthaza ukuthula ekhaya futhi ikhuthaza ukuqondana phakathi kwamalungu omndeni. 

Imithetho ithuthukisa izibopho zelungu lomndeni ngalinye, ngakho-k,e kubalulekile ukuba umndeni ube nemithetho. 

Umuzi onemithetho yomndeni uphila ngokuthula.

SourceText: Let's read what happened with @global.w_rules_teen_boy and his @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1:
text: Ake sifunde ngokwenzeke ku @global.w_rules_teen_boy no @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 wakhe:

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: "You always come home late!"

@global.w_rules_teen_boy: "No I don’t, I don’t even know what late means! Stop nagging me."
text:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Uhlale ubuya sekwephuzile ekhaya!”

@global.w_rules_teen_boy: “Cha angazi, angazi nokuthi kusuke kungubani isikhathi uma sekwephuzile! Yeka ukungicasula.”

SourceText: Which specific rule could @global.w_rules_teen_boy and @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 create together?
text: Yimuphi umthetho oqondile u @global.w_rules_teen_boy no @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 abangawenza bobabili?

SourceText: @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “That’s right, and it’s also not safe in this area to be outside after sunset. What do you think would be a good time for you to be home?”
text: @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Kunjalo, okunye futhi ukuthi akuphephile ukuba ngaphandle kule ndawo ngemva kokushona kwelanga. Ucabanga ukuthi kungaba isiphi isikhathi esifanele sokubuya ekhaya?”
note: The string @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 should not be translated.

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_teen_boy: “I could come home at 10pm?"  

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “That’s a bit late, what about 6pm? Or something in the middle?"
text:
@global.w_rules_teen_boy: “Ngingabuya ekhaya ngo-10 ebusuku?  

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Kusuke sekwephuzile ngaleso sikhathi, kungaba njani ngo-6 ntambama? Noma okuthile okuphakathi?”

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_teen_boy: “I could come home at 6pm on school nights and 10pm on Friday and Saturday?” 

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Yes, great. From now on, our household rule is that you need to come home at 6pm on school nights and 10pm on Friday and Saturday. But you always walk home with a friend. Okay?”
text:
@global.w_rules_teen_boy: “Ngingabuya ekhaya ngo-6 ntambama phakathi nezinsuku zesikole bese kuba u-10 ebusuku ngoLwesihlanu nangoMgqibelo?” 

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Yebo, kuhle lokho. Kusukela manje ukuya phambili, umthetho wasekhaya uthi kumelwe ubuye ekhaya ngo-6 ntambama ngezinsuku oya ngazo esikoleni kanti ngoLwesihlanu nangoMgqibelo ubuye ngo-10pm. Kodwa kumelwe uhlale uphelezelwa umngane uma ubuya ekhaya. “Kulungile?”

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_teen_boy: “Okay, @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1” 

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Thank you very much, @global.w_rules_teen_boy, for helping to come up with a good rule together. I am proud to see how responsible you are getting.”
text:
@global.w_rules_teen_boy: “Kulungile, @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1” 

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Ngiyabonga kakhulu, @global.w_rules_teen_boy, ngokungisiza ukuba sibeke umthetho omuhle sindawonye. Kuyangijabulisa ukubona ukuthi uba nokwethenjelwa.”

SourceText:
The next day...

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Thank you, @global.w_rules_teen_boy, for coming home on time. After you finish your schoolwork we can have your favourite meal for dinner.”
text:
Ngosuku olulandelayo...

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Ngiyabonga, @global.w_rules_teen_boy, ngokufika ekhaya ngesikhathi. Uma usuqede umsebenzi wakho wesikole sizodla ukudla okuthayo esidlweni sakusihlwa.”

SourceText: Making the rule together went well because...
text: Ukubeka umthetho ndawonye kube nomphumela omuhle ngoba...

SourceText:
* They discussed the reasons behind the rule 
* @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 listened to @global.w_rules_teen_boy’s suggestions 
* The rule was clear, specific and fair 
* @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 praised @global.w_rules_teen_boy for helping to make the rule
text:
* Baye baxoxa ngezizathu zokubeka umthetho 
* @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 uye wakulalela ukusikisela kuka-@global.w_rules_teen_boy 
* Umthetho ubucacile, uqondile futhi ubonelela 
* @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 uye wamncoma u-@global.w_rules_teen_boy ngokumsiza ekubekeni umthetho

SourceText: @global.w_rules_teen_boy knew his @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 appreciated him because...
text: @global.w_rules_teen_boy bekazi ukuthi @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 uyamazisa ngoba...

SourceText:
* She praised him
* She rewarded him when he followed the rule
text:
* Uye wamncoma
* Uye wamenzela okuthile okuhle ngenxa yokulandela umthetho

text: Yini ehambe kahle lapha ekubekeni umthetho ndawonye?

text: @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 uye wakulalela ukusikisela kuka-@global.w_rules_teen_boy

text: Umthetho ubucacile, uqondile futhi ubonelela

SourceText: @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 praised @global.w_rules_teen_boy for helping to make the rule
text: @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 uye wamncoma u-@global.w_rules_teen_boy ngokumsiza ekubekeni umthetho

SourceText: That's right, making clear rules together in a calm and positive way works so well!
text: Kunjalo, ukwenza imithetho ecacile ndawonye ngendlela ezolile neyakhayo kusebenza kahle!

SourceText: How do you think @global.w_rules_teen_boy knew his @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 appreciated him?
text: Ucabanga ukuthi u-@global.w_rules_teen_boy waze kanjani ukuthi u-@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 uyamazisa?

SourceText: She praised him
text: Uye wamncoma

SourceText: She rewarded him when he followed the rule
text: Uye wamenzela okuthile okuhle ngenxa yokulandela umthetho

SourceText: Exactly - a positive response makes all the difference!
text: Kunjalo - ukusabela ngendlela ehle kwenza umehluko!

SourceText: Household rules help keep our teenagers safe, and understand what is expected from them. When you involve a teenager in making rules they are more likely to follow them.
text: Imithetho yasekhaya isiza ukuvikele intsha yethu, futhi yenza iqonde ukuthi yini elindeleke kuyo. Uma uhilela ingane yakho eseminyakeni yokuthomba ekubekeni imithetho aba maningi okuthi iwulandela umthetho.

SourceText: TEAM RULES
text: IMITHETHO YEQEMBU

SourceText: Plan rules WITH your teenager. Start with one new rule first - you can add another one later. Discuss the reasons for the rule and listen to their views.
text: Hlela imithetho NDAWONYE nengane yakho eseminyakeni yokuthomba. Qala ngomthetho owodwa omusha - unganezela omunye ngokuhamba kwesikhathi. Xoxisanani ngezizathu zomthetho ngemva kwalokho ulalele imibono yabo.

SourceText: REAL RULES
text: IMITHETHO YANGEMPELA

SourceText: Make them realistic for what your teenager can do, and be clear and specific so there’s no misunderstanding. Not ‘on time’ but ‘by 7pm’.
text: Yenze ibe nengqondo ukuze ingane yakho eseminyakeni yokuthomba ikwazi ukuyilandelayo, cacisa futhi ukhulume ngokuqondile ukuze kungabi khona ukungaqondani. Ungathi ‘ngesikhathi’ kodwa yithi “ngo-7 ntambama”.

SourceText: PRAISE RULES!
text: UMTHETHO WOKUNCOMA!

SourceText: Praise your teen for planning a rule with you, and praise them for keeping it!
text: Ncoma ingane yakho eseminyakeni yokuthomba ngokuthi ibeke uthetho nawe, uphinde uyincome ngokuthi uwugcine!

SourceText: Online Safety
text: Ukuphepha Ku-inhanethi

SourceText: Rules are important to keep your teens safe - also online. There’s more about this in the Weekly Workshop on safety planning, but let’s already have a first look now!
text: Imithetho ibalulekile ukuze intsha yethu iphephe - naku-inthanethi. Kunokwengeziwe mayelana nokuhlela okuphephile Ekuqeqeshweni Kwamasonto Onke, kodwa ake sikubone lokhu njengamanje!

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "@global.w_rules_teen_girl, have you done your homework?"

@global.w_rules_teen_girl: "Just a minute @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2, I’m finishing this @global.teen_social_medium video"
text:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "@global.w_rules_teen_girl, usuwenzile umsebenzi wakho wesikole?"

@global.w_rules_teen_girl: “Umzuzwana nje @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2, ngisaqedela le @global.teen_social_medium vidiyo"

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "You are a really great dancer! Tell me about why you like it"

@global.w_rules_teen_girl: "All my friends are on it, @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2. I have more than 600 likes and 120 followers."
text:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: “Ave udansa kahle kakhulu! Ngitshele ukuthi kungani ukuthanda"

@global.w_rules_teen_girl: “Bonke abangane bami bayadansa, @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2. Nginama-likes angu-600 nabalandeli abangu-120.”

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "I’m proud of how well you dance, @global.w_rules_teen_girl. But we need to make sure you are safe. 

I know your friends look at @global.teen_social_medium, but with an open account, there are other people who look at videos of teenagers for their own sexual needs. Sometimes they contact teenagers. They pretend to be nice but end up threatening and abusing teens."
text:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: “Ngiyaziqhenya ngawe ngendlela odansa kahle ngayo, @global.w_rules_teen_girl. Kodwa kumelwe siqiniseka ukuba uphephile. 

Ngiyazi ukuba abangani bakho babuka @global.teen_social_medium, kodwa nge-akhawunti evulela wonke umuntu, kunabanye abantu ababuka amavidiyo abantu abasha ukuze bazanelise ngokocansi. Ngezinye izikhathi bayaxhumana nentsha. Bazenza sengathi balungile kodwa ekugcineni bayabesabisa futhi bayihlukumeze intsha.”

SourceText: @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "I’m proud of you @global.w_rules_teen_girl"
text: @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: “Ngiyaziqhenya ngawe @global.w_rules_teen_girl”

SourceText:
* What is one important rule you’d each like to make with your teenager? 
* What do you think your teen will think about that rule? 

Remember, make rules specific and realistic!
text:
* Yimuphi umthetho obalulekile eningafisa ukuwubeka nengane yakho eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili?  
* Ucabanga ukuthi ingane yakho eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili izocabangani ngalo mthetho? 

Khumbula, beka umthetho oqondile kodwa onengqondo!

SourceText: Here are some of the rules other families created:
text: Nayi eminye imithetho eminye imindeni eyibekile:

SourceText:
* Teen can play outside after finishing homework
* All family members are eating dinner together
* Teen 1 does dishes on Sunday and Monday, Teen 2 on Tuesday and Wednesday
* We speak to each other politely and nicely
* When listening to music you need to use earphones
text:
* Ingane yakho eyevile eminyakeni eyishumi nambili ingadlala ngaphandle ngemva kokuqeda umsebenzi wasekhaya
* Onke amalungu omndeni adla isidlo sakusihlwa ndawonye
* Ingane yakho yokuqala igeza izitsha ngeSonto nangoMsombuluko, bese eyesibili izigeze ngoLwesibili nangoLwesithathu 
* Sikhulumisana ngenhlonipho nangomusa 
* Uma ulalela umculo kumelwe usebenzise ama-earphones

SourceText: Let's practice making rules.
text: Ake sizame ukubeka imithetho.

SourceText:
Write down one important rule you’d like to make with your teenager – you'll be doing this as your home practice this week. 

What will they think about it?
text:
Bhala phansi umthetho owodwa obalulekile ongathanda ukuwubeka nengane yakho eseminyakeni yokuthomba - uzokwenza lokhu njengomsebenzi wasekhaya wokuprakthiza waleli viki. 

Yini abazoyicabanga ngawo?

SourceText:
This week, set one rule together with your teen.

Remember to praise your teen afterwards!
text:
Kuleli viki, bekani umthetho owodwa nengane yakho eseminyakeni yokuthomba.

Khumbula ukuncoma ingane yakho eseminyakeni yokuthomba ngemva kwalokho!

SourceText: Being a great parent also means taking time to care for yourself every day.
text: Ukuba umzali ophumeleleyo kusho ukuzibekela eceleni isikhathi sokuzinakekela nsuku zonke.

SourceText: Great. And amazing that you are using this app – it shows your commitment as a parent. Make sure you give yourself credit and praise for what you are doing.
text: Kuhle. Kuyamangalisa nokuthi usebenzisa le-app - kubonisa indlela ozimisela ngayo njengomzali. Qiniseka ukuthi uyazivuza futhi uzincome ngalokho okwenzayo.

SourceText: Being a parent is hard. But it is amazing that you are using this app – it shows your commitment as a parent. Make sure you give yourself credit and praise for what you are doing.
text: Kunzima ukuba umzali. Kodwa kuyamangalisa nokuthi usebenzisa le-app - kubonisa indlela ozimisela ngayo njengomzali. Qiniseka ukuthi uyazivuza futhi uzincome ngalokho okwenzayo.

SourceText: Doing any of these makes you a great parent.
text: Ukwenza noma ngabe yini kulezi zinto kubonisa ukuthi ungumzali omuhle.

SourceText:
Teens can spend a lot of time outside the house or online, where it is harder for us to keep them safe. 

Talking together about safe and unsafe places, and how to prevent problems, really helps!
text:
Intsha ingasebenzisa isikhathi esiningi ingaphandle noma iku-inthanethi, lapho kunzima khona ngathi ukuba siyigcine iphephile. 

Ukuxoxisana ngezindawo eziphephile nezindawo ezingaphephanga, nokuthi singazigwema kanjani izinkinga, kuyasiza ngempela!

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone. 

Today our topic is teen safety. 

It is our responsibility as parents to keep our teens safe at all times. We need to ensure that our teenagers are safe in the communities that we live in. It is our responsibility that we make them aware of the safe and unsafe areas in the communities. 

It is also our responsibility to ensure that they understand the dangers that they might be exposed to when they are online. That way our teenagers will be responsible and be able to make right decisions to keep themselves safe too.
text:
Sanibonani, nonke. 

Isihloko sanamuhla sikhuluma ngokuphepha kwentsha. 

Kuwumthwalo wethu njengabazali ukuthi siqiniseka ukuthi intsha yethu iphephile ngaso sonke isikhathi. Kudingeka siqiniseka ukuthi intsha yethu iphephile emphakathini esihlala kuyo. Kuwumthwalo wethu ukuba sibenze baqaphele izindawo eziphephile nezingaphephanga emphakathini. 

Kubuye kube umthwalo wethu wemfanelo ukuqinisekisa ukuthi iyaziqonda izingozi ezichaya kuzo uma iku-inthanethi. Ngaleyo ndlela intsha yethu izohlakanipha ikwazi ukwenza izinqumo ezinhle futhi izigcine iphephile.

Communication is the most important thing!

Let's see what happened with @global.w_safe_female_caregiver and @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1:
text:
Ukukhulumisana kuyinto ebaluleke kakhulu!

Ake sibone ukuthi yini eyenzeke ku @global.w_safe_female_caregiver no @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1 wakhe:

SourceText:
@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: "Something happened when I was out with my friends @global.w_safe_teen_girl_2 and @global.w_safe_teen_girl_3!"

@global.w_safe_female_caregiver: "Tell me, @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1"
text:
@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: “Kunokuthile okwenzeke ngesikhathi ngiphume nabangane bami @global.w_safe_teen_girl_2 no @global.w_safe_teen_girl_3!"

@global.w_safe_female_caregiver: “Ngitshele, @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1"

SourceText:
Man in car: “Hey beautiful. I have been looking at you for a while. You are very beautiful, what’s your name?  

@global.w_safe_teen_girl_2: “Her name is @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1”
text:
Indoda esemotweni: “Ntokazi enhle. Sekuyisikhathi eside ngilokhu ngikubuka. Umuhle kakhulu, ungubani igama lakho?  

@global.w_safe_teen_girl_2: “Igama lakhe u-@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1”

SourceText:
Man in car: “@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1, would you like to come with me to have something to drink and chips? Come on, get in, you’ll be back in time, I promise…” 

@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: “I’m not sure if that’s a good idea…”
text:
Indoda esemotweni: @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1, ungathanda yini ukuhamba nami siyofuna okuphuzwayo namashibusi? Ngiyakucela, ngena, uzobuya ngesikhathi, ngiyakuthembisa...” 

@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: “Angiqiniseki ukuthi umbono omuhle lowo...”

SourceText: @global.w_safe_teen_girl_2: “You are lucky, my friend. I wish a man would ask ME out and buy me gifts. I’m telling you, if you don’t do this I’m going to tell everyone you are stupid!”
text: @global.w_safe_teen_girl_2: “Unenhlanhla, mngane wami. Ngifisa sengathi indoda ingacela ukukhipha MINA ingithengele izipho. Ngiyakutshela, uma ungakwenzi lokhu ngizotshela wonke umuntu ukuthi uyisilima!”
note: The string @global.w_safe_teen_girl_2 should not be translated.

SourceText:
@global.w_safe_teen_girl_3: “@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1 don’t go! Be careful! Let’s go home. It is dangerous to go with people you don’t know. Besides, he’s too old for you and what he is doing is wrong."

@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: “I just don’t know…”
text:
@global.w_safe_teen_girl_3: “@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1 ungahambi! Qaphela! Asihambe siye ekhaya. Kuyingozi ukuhamba nabantu ongabazi. Ngaphandle kwalokho, mdala kunawe futhi akwenzayo akulungile.”

@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: “Eqinisweni angazi....”

SourceText: @global.w_safe_female_caregiver: "Pfff, I am so proud of you that you did not get into the car. That was a dangerous situation, thank you for telling me!"
text: @global.w_safe_female_caregiver: “Mhh, ngiyaziqhenya ngawe ngokuthi awuyigibelanga le moto. Bekuyisimo esiyingozi lesi, ngiyabonga ngokuthi ungitshele!”
note: The string @global.w_safe_female_caregiver should not be translated.

text: Ake sikhulume ngokwenzeke ku-@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1

Discuss together: 

What was risky about that situation?

Yini ebe yingozi ngalesi simo?
